event.description:
Save your seat for a special early access screening of WEAPONS, the latest horror/thriller from the mind behind BARBARIAN. Enjoy our special themed menu of Tito's and soda with lime, a bloody mary, an espresso martini, and a honey thyme fried chicken sandwich.

When all but one child from the same class mysteriously vanish on the same night at exactly the same time, a community is left questioning who or what is behind their disappearance.

show.title: Clueless
show.headline: The essential ‘90s teen comedy

event.title: <show-title>Clueless</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Make a cameo at this interactive party
event.description:
Before reinventing Jane Austen became cliché, Amy Heckerling adapted the classic story of Emma into a hilarious, insanely clever satire of adolescence in Beverly Hills. CLUELESS spawned fashion trends and countless slang terms (AS IF!) and gave Alicia Silverstone a reason to exist beyond Aerosmith videos. Almost 30 years later(!), we are still majorly, totally, butt-crazy in love with this movie.

At this special interactive screening, we'll roll with the homies and say all of our favorite lines together, plus we'll have props to help us pretend that, for one glorious night, we're the Class of '95 at Bronson Alcott High School. Our eternally popular CLUELESS Movie Party is waiting with fuzzy pens, scrunchies, shopping bags, and Statue of Liberty stickers for your Cher Horowitz starter kit.

So slip on your Calvin Klein dress – or come dressed as any of your favorite characters (the more Dionnes, the better!) – and make time in your busy pants-dropping schedule to attend.

contentBlocks.paragraphs:

titleCardImage.altText: Movie Party TC

show.title: Ghostbusters (1984)
show.headline: Cross the streams into a spectral-blast of fun

event.title: <show-title>Ghostbusters (1984)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Get slimed and bust boredom at our interactive screening of the 1984 classic
event.description: Suit up for our live-hosted celebration of proton packs, paranormal panic, and New York’s most unlikely heroes: Ray, Egon, Peter, and Winston. This interactive screening packs in all the ectoplasmic fun you can handle, complete with themed props to keep you in on every bust and banter. You’ll score some Ghost Slime, a reasonably sized Marshmallow, and Red & Blue Glow Necklaces. Pack your trap and get ready to take down Gozer.

titleCardImage.altText: Movie Party TC

show.title: The Outsiders: The Complete Novel
show.headline: S.E. Hinton's teen dream classic

event.title: <show-title>The Outsiders: The Complete Novel</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Switchblades, smoke rings, and a party you’ll never forget
event.description: Step out of the darkness and into the world of the Greasers at our live-hosted Movie Party for THE OUTSIDERS: THE COMPLETE NOVEL. Whether you’ve read the book a dozen times or watched the film until the tape wore out, this is your chance to experience it in a whole new way. Your ticket doesn’t just get you a seat – it gears you up. Every guest will score a Greaser comb, Johnny’s sun catcher, and Ponyboy’s pencil to jot down your own thoughts or even start your own story. Come dressed as a Greaser or a Soc if you feel like it, and don’t forget to bring your crew. So meet us at the movie house, duck into the shadows, and emerge ready to stand tall under the bright sunlight. Stay gold.

show.title: All That Heaven Allows
show.headline: The magnificent stars of MAGNIFICENT OBSESSION reunited

event.title: <show-title>All That Heaven Allows</show-title>
event.headline: Rock Hudson & Jane Wyman resist conformity in Douglas Sirk’s landmark melodrama
event.description:
“And you want me to be a man?”

WOMEN’S FILMS! WEEPIES! MELODRAMA! The works of Douglas Sirk were underappreciated in their time, but critical reevaluation from film historians (and queers) has proved that these “weepies” have real value! Sirk had a vision of 1950s suburban life that America wasn’t ready to receive; his films highlighted the desires and frustrations of women and the struggles of the modern family in gorgeous Technicolor. In ALL THAT HEAVEN ALLOWS – Sirk is at his most Sirk-ian, perhaps – Jane Wyman is Cary Scott, a widowed mother of two, apparently ancient in her early forties, when she begins a relationship with hunky arborist Ron Kirby, played by the queer legend Rock Hudson. Will her children and society at large be able to accept that Cary is in love with a slightly younger Bohemian man? Or will Cary and Ron’s love crumble under the crushing weight of 1950s propriety? Does this film about taboo love and unfair judgment feel extra potent since it stars one of the most famous closeted queer actors of all time? THE MELODRAMA OF IT ALL! Hugely influential on the work of queer auteurs like Rainer Werner Fassbinder, John Waters, and Todd Haynes, ALL THAT HEAVEN ALLOWS is a film that defined a genre and holds a special place in the Queer Film Theory archives.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Hackers
show.headline: “We have just gotten a wake-up call from the Nintendo Generation."

event.title: <show-title>Hackers</show-title>
event.headline: '90s neon cyberpunk gender-freak ecstasy
event.description:
Yes, I am a criminal. My crime is that of curiosity.

1995. NEW YORK. CYBERSPACE. High school.

The 1990s were truly a special time. The burgeoning promise of the internet connecting people across the globe opened the door for more experimentation and cross-cultural creation. Social media had yet to ruin our lives, Amazon was a quaint little start-up selling books, and The X-Files was must-see TV. HACKERS is quintessential '90s schlock that some would call “bad,” and I would call that “homophobic.” Everyone in this damn movie is serving high-key non-binary charisma, uniqueness, nerve, and talent. Okay, wait, let's talk about the plot. At just 11 years old, Dade “Zero Cool” Murphy (Jonny Lee Miller) infamously hacked over 1,500 computer systems and crashed the stock market. After his 18th birthday, Dade's “don’t touch computers” probation is lifted and he immediately returns to hacking the house down boots with his new NYC hacker community, including Acid Burn (Angelina Jolie), Cereal Killer (Matthew Lillard), Phantom Phreak (Renoly Santiago), Lord Nikon (Laurence Mason), and novice Joey (Jesse Bradford). As the crew attempts to “hack the planet,” they are pursued by former hacker-turned-sell-out sleaze The Plague (Fisher Stevens) and US Secret Service Agent Dick Gill (Wendell Pierce) for dubiously explained reasons. Also, Mark Anthony is here, apparently? Dismissed in its time, HACKERS has gone on to develop a cult following of mostly queer fans, and it is the perfect summer film to usher in the new school year at Queer Film Theory 101.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Bloody Moon
show.headline: Jess Franco's sole entry into the slasher genre - equal parts love and hate

event.title: <show-title>Bloody Moon</show-title>
event.headline: Jess Franco's sole entry into the slasher genre - equal parts love and hate!
event.description:
As the 'body-count' genre stabbed its way into audiences' hearts in the early '80s, EuroTrash auteur Jess Franco (Sadomania, Mansion Of The Living Dead) was asked to create his own saga of slaughtered schoolgirls complete with gratuitous nudity, graphic violence, and gory set pieces. But just when you thought you'd seen it all, Franco shocked the world by delivering surprising style, genuine suspense and a cavalcade of depravity that includes incest, voyeurism and roller disco. The luscious Olivia Pascal of Vanessa fame stars in this twisted thriller that was banned in England yet is now presented uncut and uncensored - including the complete 'stone mill power saw' sequence - for the first time ever!

DCP courtesy of Severin Films and the American Genre Film Archive

show.title: Four Flies on Grey Velvet
show.headline: Dario Argento's underrated shocker.

event.title: <show-title>Four Flies on Grey Velvet</show-title>
event.headline: Dario Argento's underrated shocker.
event.description: A prog rock drummer is framed and blackmailed for a murder he did not commit. As he enlists the help of a swishy gay detective to find out who’s responsible, the real killer begins bumping off those around him one by one. The final (and least seen) film in Dario Argento’s so-called Animal Trilogy, FOUR FLIES ON GREY VELVET is a stylish tour de force of gruesome violence, twisty giallo plotting, and even more twisted up gender and sexuality. (Austin Film Society)

show.title: Frailty
show.headline: There are demons among us

event.title: <show-title>Frailty</show-title>
event.headline: Bill Paxton's searing directorial effort, newly restored.
event.description:
Set in present-day Texas, FRAILTY centers on the FBI's search for a serial killer who calls himself "God's Hands." Matthew McConaughey plays Fenton Meeks, a young man who approaches the lead investigator one night, claiming he knows the identity of the killer. The FBI agent is curious but unimpressed until Fenton reveals that the killer is his younger brother Adam. This is a film about faith, family, and the end of innocence.

New 4K restoration courtesy of Lionsgate

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: From Dusk Till Dawn
show.headline: The Quentin Tarantino-penned blood-soaked vampire crime caper

event.title: <show-title>From Dusk Till Dawn</show-title>
event.headline: The Quentin Tarantino-penned blood-soaked vampire crime caper.
event.description:
In FROM DUSK TILL DAWN, longtime friends Quentin Tarantino and Robert Rodriguez joined forces for a chocolate/peanut butter hybrid of tense crime drama and all-out monster mash. George Clooney and Tarantino are the Gecko brothers. They're professional thieves – one honorable, one terrifying. Harvey Keitel, Juliette Lewis, and Ernest Liu are the family they've forced to help them flee across the border. And the great Salma Hayek is Santanico Pandemonium, the nefarious leader of the army of vampires who happen to run the bar where the Gecko brothers' contacts were supposed to meet them. All these players collide in a gloriously zonked and bloody brawl.

SF: 35mm print courtesy of Odyssey Film Institute

Raleigh/DFW/Twin Cities: DCP courtesy of Paramount Pictures

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Ghoulies II
show.headline: They'll get you in the end...again!

event.title: <show-title>Ghoulies II</show-title>
event.headline: Theatrical premiere of the uncut 4K restoration
event.description:
Every GHOULIES movie is a gift to humankind, and there is no greater gift than GHOULIES II. After being reinvigorated by a vat of toxic waste, the Ghoulies hitch a ride to a carnival spookhouse called Satan’s Den. From there, Ghoulies bite off people's faces and barf on children. Newly restored in a previously unseen, uncut version that adds more bloodshed, GHOULIES II feels like a neon-drenched episode of Goosebumps with gore and the F-word. Add the glorious stop-motion animation and puppetry work by John Carl Buechler (TROLL) and you get slimy, non-stop joy. This includes some death via bumper-car.

Screening the uncut 4K restoration

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Raw (2016)
show.headline: Stay hungry for this provocative coming-of-age stunner

event.title: <show-title>Raw (2016)</show-title>
event.headline: Stay hungry for this provocative coming-of-age stunner.
event.description:
Every now and again, a debut film comes along that makes you sit up and recognize a major new talent has announced itself. That’s RAW, and that’s director Julia Ducournau. RAW isn’t just one of the great horror movies of the year, it’s one of the great movies of the year, full stop, and it’s a film that manages to be grisly and gorgeous, funny and creepy, honest and totally messed up all at once.

When Justine (Garance Marillier) goes to veterinary school, the young vegetarian is forced, in a hazing ritual, to eat some raw meat. That bite awakens something deep inside of her, and suddenly she is transformed from a meek nerd into a ravenous, sexually confident cannibal.

RAW weaves themes of addiction, female coming of age, and sexual exploration into a bloody tapestry that drenches the screen in sheer cinematic glory. Beautiful and brutal, RAW is one of those movies you have to see with an audience, if only so you have other people to share in your screams and squirms.

DCP courtesy of Universal Pictures & Focus Features

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Red Rooms
show.headline: A woman attends the trial of a serial killer she's obsessed with

event.title: <show-title>Red Rooms</show-title>
event.headline: The insta-classic true crime-addicted stunner.
event.description:
Presented in French with English subtitles

Kelly-Anne (Juliette Gariépy) wakes up every morning by the courthouse to secure a seat at the high-profile trial of Ludovic Chevalier (Maxwell McCabe-Lokos), a serial killer she is obsessed with. As days go by, the young woman bonds with another groupie (Laurie Babin), which momentarily breaks her out of her loneliness. But as the proceedings drag on and she spends more time in the courtroom with the victims’ families, Kelly-Anne finds it increasingly difficult to maintain her psychological balance and assume her morbid fixation with the killer. She will then do whatever it takes to get her hands on the final piece of the puzzle: the missing video of a murdered 13-year-old girl, to whom Kelly-Anne bears a disturbing resemblance.

DCP courtesy of Utopia

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Spree
show.headline: This Sundance hit explores the horrors of a culture who favors likes and views

event.title: <show-title>Spree</show-title>
event.headline: Steve from STRANGER THINGS rides into the 21st century.
event.description:
Meet Kurt, from @KurtsWorld96 (Joe Keery of STRANGER THINGS). He dreams of sitting atop a social media empire, but for now he drives for the rideshare company Spree. Fortunately, Kurt has come up with the perfect way to go viral: #TheLesson. He’s decked out his car with cameras for a nonstop livestream full of killer entertainment – murdering his passengers. In the middle of all this madness, a stand-up comedian (Sasheer Zamata) with her own viral agenda crosses Kurt’s path and becomes the only hope to put an end to his misguided carnage.

DCP courtesy of the Independent Film Company

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Cell
show.headline: J-Lo at her most stunning in Tarsem's lush and dangerous thriller.

event.title: <show-title>The Cell</show-title>
event.headline: J-Lo at her most stunning in Tarsem's lush and dangerous thriller.
event.description:
If a horror movie took place inside of the music video for Nirvana’s “Heart-Shaped Box,” it would feel a lot like THE CELL. Psychologist Catherine Deane (Jennifer Lopez) has developed an experimental virtual reality treatment for coma patients. But when she enters the brain of a comatose serial killer (Vincent D'Onofrio, Daredevil), Deane melts into a terrifying dreamscape that short-circuits her life. Directed by Indian filmmaker Tarsem Singh and featuring gorgeous costume design from Eiko Ishioka (BRAM STOKER’S DRACULA), THE CELL is an acid-drenched spectacle that should only ever be experienced on the big screen. (Joseph A. Ziemba)

DCP courtesy of Warner Bros.

show.title: The Doom Generation
show.headline: Gregg Araki's teenage wasteland

show.title: Dirty Work
show.headline: Revenge is sweet (and surprisingly affordable!)

event.title: <show-title>Dirty Work</show-title>
event.headline: Revenge is sweet (and surprisingly affordable!)
event.description: After losing his job, girlfriend, and apartment, lifelong prankster Mitch moves in with his childhood best friend Sam, and Sam’s cantankerous father, Pops. When Pops has a heart attack, his surgeon, Dr. Farthing, delivers grim news: Pops needs a new heart, which Farthing will gladly secure in exchange for $50,000 to pay off his gambling debts. Desperate for a lot of cash quickly, Sam and Mitch realize that their joint love of causing mischief could be the perfect means of raising funds, thus opening a revenge-for-hire business named “Dirty Work.” With creative solutions to spiteful problems and chaotically doled-out retribution, clients are lining up. But when an evil local politician hires them to pull off an especially malicious prank, Mitch is forced to reckon with the consequences of his actions. (Vinegar Syndrome)

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Going Down
show.headline: It’s a dog-eat-dog world and there’s never enough dog to go around…

event.title: <show-title>Going Down</show-title>
event.headline: It’s a dog-eat-dog world and there’s never enough dog to go around…
event.description:
Middle-class Karli (Tracy Mann), alcoholic Jane (Vera Plevnik), unemployed Jackie (Julie Barry), and square Ellen (Moira MacLaine-Cross) are four friends living together and barely scraping by in suburban Sydney. But when Karli’s father offers her a little money and a one-way ticket to New York, she finally sees a way out of her dead-end life—that is, until the money goes missing, kickstarting a final night out on the town that none of them will ever forget.

With a screenplay written by and based on the lives of two of its stars, performances from local Sydney bands Pel Mel and the Dynamic Hepnotics, and supporting appearances by a handful of beloved Ozploitation regulars—including David Argue (BMX BANDITS) and Hugh Keays-Byrne (MAD MAX)—Haydn Keenan’s debut feature Going Down is an underseen landmark of Australian cinema and a vivid portrait of Sydney in the early 80s. Existing somewhere between Susan Seidelman’s SMITHEREENS and Juliet Berto and Jean-Henri Roger’s NEIGE in its depictions of the thrills and dangers of urban life, Going Down is a visceral testament to friendship and making it at any cost.

New 4K restoration courtesy of Muscle Distribution

show.title: Night of the Juggler
show.headline: The underrated Fun City scuzzbomb, newly restored.

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Night of the Juggler Still 1 min

portraitHeroImage.altText: Night of the Juggler Still 1 min

event.title: <show-title>Night of the Juggler</show-title>
event.headline: The underrated Fun City scuzzbomb, newly restored.
event.description:
Get ready for Brolin Thunder! New York City in the late 70s and early 80s was portrayed on silver screens across the globe as the place on the planet most likely to resemble urban hell on earth. Walk a block in the wrong direction and you'll get harassed by punks, mugged by a rainbow coalition of thugs, end up in the middle of a gang fight, get propositioned by prostitutes and brutalized by a crooked police officer. This savage, ruthless landscape is the setting for one of the most intense crime thrillers to come out of the studio system. James Brolin plays a former police officer who goes balls-to-the-wall-ballistic when his daughter is kidnapped by a psychopath (Cliff Gorman). A three-way chase ensues as Brolin tears apart Manhattan in pursuit of the kidnapper while two detectives, character actor extraordinaire Dan Hedaya and THE GODFATHER's Richard S. Castellano, attempt to put a stop to his vigilante mission. If that cast weren't impressive enough, Mandy "Inigo Montoya" Patinkin nearly steals the whole movie as a fast talking Puerto Rican cabbie. NIGHT OF THE JUGGLER is a rip-roaring rager that makes the most of its New York setting, shot largely on location with natural light and barely any blocking off from the public. Just like the city, it's raw, full of fast flying insults, violence, and seedy people. Happy holidays! (Lars Nilsen)

4k DCP courtesy of Kino Lorber

show.title: Nocturama
show.headline: A slice of hypernormalization from Bertrand Bonnello.

event.title: <show-title>Nocturama</show-title>
event.headline: A slice of hypernormalization from Bertrand Bonnello.
event.description:
Presented in French with English subtitles

Recalling Robert Bresson’s THE DEVIL, PROBABLY as much as it does George A. Romero’s DAWN OF THE DEAD, Bertrand Bonnello's terrorist thriller is like no other. We first follow a group of tense, shifty adolescents as they prowl the streets and subways of Paris, learning through carefully delineated sequences that they’re already well underway with a bombing plot. And then it becomes something familiar, yet altogether different, as these subversives tuck away inside a shopping mall and lose themselves in consumer culture — clothes, televisions, toys, and a stirring soundtrack that includes Blondie, Chief Keef, Shirley Bassey, Bonello’s menacing electronic score, and Willow Smith. Will they survive the unseen, encroaching authorities? Or, as the walls close in, will they even survive each other? NOCTURAMA forgoes easy answers, making way for one of the 21st century’s most stunning cinematic experiences. (Grasshopper Film)

DCP courtesy of Grasshopper Film

show.title: Paprika
show.headline: Reach into the depths of imagination and anime.

event.title: <show-title>Paprika</show-title>
event.headline: Reach into the depths of imagination.
event.description:
Presented in Japanese with English subtitles

Satoshi Kon's vibrant 2006 sci-fi anime PAPRIKA came around at a time in the mid-2000s post-Y2K, post-THE MATRIX when technology was in a state of flux and the idea(l) of being able to enter a dreamspace seemed like a thrilling possibility! Combining stunning animation with Kon's unique brand of societal insight and a dream logic that is in turn otherworldly and sincere, PAPRIKA is animation cinema that triggers all senses, culminating in an overdrive for, by and about the mind.

DCP courtesy of Sony Pictures Classics

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Point Blank (1967)
show.headline: Lee Marvin runs roughshod across the West Coast.

event.title: <show-title>Point Blank (1967)</show-title>
event.headline: Lee Marvin runs roughshod across the West Coast.
event.description:
British director John Boorman brought a European sensibility to a Los Angeles neo-noir: POINT BLANK is Antonioni plus violence, Francesco Rosi without politics. The title reverberates like a pun-point: blank. Lee Marvin is Walker, left for dead in an Alcatraz heist and now out to find the $93,000 he has coming. No more, no less, unless you count revenge. The trail leads to the City of Angels and the syndicate that runs it out of car lots and Santa Monica penthouses, the kind of places you know exist only with a little larceny. Picking up on the modern surface of his locale, Boorman takes a champagne-blonde color scheme to a hallucinatory degree, blonde on blond, like Angie Dickinson's bouffant and Marvin's silvery pate (here, we have the bad, the brunette, and the bald). Los Angeles is inherently horizontal. The payoff, visually and narratively, occurs in that storm drain affectionately known as the L.A. River, viewed from a bridge over imagined waters. (BAMPFA)

DCP courtesy of Warner Bros.

show.title: Psycho Beach Party
show.headline: The camp classic, newly restored

event.title: <show-title>Psycho Beach Party</show-title>
event.headline: The camp classic, newly restored.
event.description:
Based on Charles Busch’s hilarious long-running stage play, PSYCHO BEACH PARTY is a wickedly fun satire of Hollywood movie genres. Chicklet (Lauren Ambrose, CAN’T HARDLY WAIT, HBO’s SIX FEET UNDER), a wannabe surf-girl with a split personality, becomes the primary suspect after a string of humorously gruesome murders terrifies the teen set. When the clues take her to the beach, the fun and suspense begin.

At the beach, Chicklet crosses paths with burnt-out surf guru Kanaka (Thomas Gibson, DHARMA & GREG), dreamy surfboy Starcat (Nicholas Brendon, BUFFY THE VAMPIRE SLAYER), and stylish homicide detective Monica Stark (Charles Busch, HBO’s OZ). PSYCHO BEACH PARTY also stars Matt Keeslar (SCREAM 3), Beth Broderick (SABRINA THE TEENAGE WITCH), Kimberley Davies (THE NEXT BEST THING), Amy Adams (DROP DEAD GORGEOUS, THE MASTER, AMERICAN HUSTLE) And Kathleen Robertson (SCARY MOVIE II). (Strand Releasing)

DCP courtesy of Strand Releasing

show.title: Vice Squad
show.headline: Pure-cut '80s L.A. grime.

event.title: <show-title>Vice Squad</show-title>
event.headline: Pure-cut '80s L.A. grime.
event.description:
Former soap star and crooner Wings Hauser burst onto the exploitation scene with his intense, over-the-top performance as the psychotic killer pimp Ramrod. Seething and ranting, a homicidal twisted nerve, Hauser is incredible. This is his show all the way – he even sings the theme song "Neon Slime!" Along the way, Hauser jumps the fence from villain into full-on monster territory, making VICE SQUAD not only one of the most exciting films you'll ever see, but one of the scariest as well. In this truly grim urban fairytale, a hooker named Princess (Season Hubley) must make it through a long night in a very dark forest (the streets of L.A.) without being gobbled up by the big bad wolf (Hauser), who himself is being chased by the mighty hunter (the LAPD detective who earlier allowed him to escape.) Pure, sleazed-out entertainment.

New DCP courtesy of Rialto Pictures

show.title: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time (Subtitled)
show.headline: There is a future that we can't wait for

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME

posterImages.altText: THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME

event.title: <show-title>The Girl Who Leapt Through Time (Subtitled)</show-title> <event-type-title>in 4K</event-type-title>
event.headline: There is a future that we can't wait for
event.description:
Makoto is a typical teenage girl who spends most of her days slacking off with friends. One day while rushing to meet her aunt, she nearly gets hit by a train, but at the last second, finds herself jumping backward in time to before the accident. She immediately makes use of her newfound ability to redo every minor inconvenience – from poor exam results to awkward confessions of love. However, when faced with the consequences of tampering with time, Makoto must do everything she can to avoid a dire future that can’t be reversed.

THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME is a beloved early film from Mamoru Hosoda, the Academy Award-nominated director behind BELLE, WOLF CHILDREN, SUMMER WARS, and more. Hosoda weaves together the timeless, breathtaking visuals he is known for with a tender-hearted story of a girl navigating first love, time travel, and the perilous choices that come with both.

image.altText: THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME

show.title: Highest 2 Lowest

event.title: <show-title>Highest 2 Lowest</show-title> <event-type-title>Early Access</event-type-title>
event.headline: Be the first to see Spike Lee's adaptation of Kurosawa’s HIGH AND LOW
event.description: When a titan music mogul (Denzel Washington), widely known as having the “best ears in the business,” is targeted with a ransom plot, he is jammed up in a life-or-death moral dilemma. Brothers Denzel Washington and Spike Lee reunite for the fifth in their long working relationship for a reinterpretation of the great filmmaker Akira Kurosawa’s crime thriller HIGH AND LOW, now played out on the mean streets of modern-day New York City.

Makoto is a typical teenage girl who spends most of her days slacking off with friends. One day while rushing to meet her aunt, she nearly gets hit by a train, but at the last second, finds herself jumping backward in time to before the accident. She immediately makes use of her newfound ability to redo every minor inconvenience – from poor exam results to awkward confessions of love. THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME is a beloved early film from Mamoru Hosoda, the Academy Award-nominated director behind BELLE, WOLF CHILDREN, SUMMER WARS, and more. titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: In the Mood for Love
show.headline: Wong Kar-Wai's mesmerizing tale of love never realized

event.title: <show-title>In the Mood for Love</show-title> <event-type-title>25th Anniversary</event-type-title>
event.headline: Including IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 2001, only screened at the 2001 Cannes
event.description:
About IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE:

Hong Kong, 1962: Chow Mo-wan (Tony Leung Chiu-wai) and Su Li-zhen (Maggie Cheung Man-yuk) move into neighboring apartments on the same day. Their encounters are formal and polite – until a discovery about their spouses creates an intimate bond between them. At once delicately mannered and visually extravagant, Wong Kar Wai’s IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE is a masterful evocation of romantic longing and fleeting moments. With its aching musical soundtrack and exquisitely abstract cinematography by Christopher Doyle and Mark Lee Ping-bin, this film has been a major stylistic influence on the past 25 years of cinema.

About IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 2001:

Initially conceived as one-third of a triptych about food, IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE was expanded into a stand-alone feature that won immediate recognition as a modern-day classic. Another third – intended as the “dessert,” as Wong Kar Wai has put it – was, until now, only screened during his masterclass at the 2001 Cannes Film Festival. Now available in wide release for the first time, IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 2001 demonstrates the director’s masterful ability to generate palpable atmosphere and striking characterizations on a miniature canvas – with IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE stars Tony Leung Chiu Wai and Maggie Cheung Man Yuk once again providing the sizzling chemistry – evoking the mystery of transient, unexpected connections in the modern city through his inimitable romantic touch.

Plays as part of IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 25th Anniversary Edition. In theaters only! (Janus)

posterImage.altText: IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 25th Anniversary

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: For all ages shows, we welcome babies and kids of all ages. The no talking rules are relaxed, since kids will be kids. But other than that, you can expect the full Alamo experience.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.
